# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt])
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym`. The values in this new column are generated by applying the `Dates.format` function to each value in the `dt` column of the DataFrame, formatting it as "yyyyMM".
